description:
immediately crashes and does so on every subsequent attempt
 impossible to get it to even play a single file without it freezing up

It is not that the interface does not look good, it is that is not well designed from the usability perspective, when you press to record it opens a float dialog with a lot of buttons and options, and it is recording while it looks like it is waiting for more config.

Given the dearth of amazing audio editors on Linux/Ubuntu, your choices are pretty much limited to Audacity or KWave for workable solutions. For me Audacity has a really dated GUI and is prone to being a memory hog. KWave's interface isn't going to win any awards but it is clear and uncluttered and the program doesn't eat my memory like a Blue Whale gorging on krill.
Great for sound recording and setting mic levels
How can I record by microphone? not started by red dot?

The app has the most ridiculously stupid UI I've ever seen in my life. But once you finally figure out how the settings need to be to accomplish what you're trying to do, it gets the job done. I just needed an app to record audio straight from the mix on my PC, which apparently Audacity can no longer do.

Kwave is a fantastic application.
This would be my preference over Audacity but is not due to a lack of FX's.
If the FX's were on par with Audacity this would absolutely be my first choice for a simple 'DAW'.

I have tried a lot of application to record audio. Audacity couldn't catch the browser as source, audio recorder was crashing and was working randomly. Kwave is not the best, but is best for recording. It has the option to record and save in mp3 if you set correct options in the settings. Otherwise it doesn't work.

It opens the file in the format it is, it saves it in the format it was opened. You don't have to create a proyect, or export. 

It is just simple. You open, edit, save, close.I love it. 

If it does not fit your needs, don't rateit low, it does what it says it does. If you need an app with more features use an app with more features.

Very unresponsive, reaction to clicking 'play' takes more than a second.
Reliably crashes after playing part of .wav file more than once.
I've been waiting a year for it to start working properly - I'm giving up. I'm using Kubuntu 20.04, and maybe other distros don't have the problems, but it's unusable for me.

Interfaz poco amigable, 
es muy dificil recomendar este editor porque audacity 
es en todo aspecto mejor.
